programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with Ben and Amanda Wallace, who had to decide if they wanted to relocate from the UK to Sydney after spending a trial week in the city. The couple emigrated to New Zealand in the mid-2000s, but the move ended in divorce. Later, remarried, the pair had to decide if they and daughters Libby and Aimee should run the risk of failure a second time around

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a terraced property in Kent, a one-bedroom house in Carlisle, and a fire-damaged property in Derby, which are all about to be sold at auction. After the sale, they talk to the new owners about their plans for the houses, and check on their progress at a later date

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers help a pub landlord who paid Â£10,000 for wind turbines that did not work and try to recover money owed to a horse breeder. Plus, sheriff Pete has bad news for an aircraft company that has not paid its debts

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright examines the case of a woman who raised the suspicions of Oxford City Council when she returned to the UK and claimed benefits after living abroad for 30 years. He also meets the people who helped 84-year-old hospital patient Dorothy find a way to stay in her own home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Colin Young offer advice to two teams searching for collectibles at the Shropshire and West Midlands Showground in Shrewsbury, where a Wedgwood bowl and a magic lantern projector are among the items bought for auction. Tim Wonnacott also visits Nunnington Hall in North Yorkshire

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A New York lawyer visiting Letherbridge to pay respects to her late aunt causes trouble for Jimmi and provides Mandy with a challenging day. Meanwhile, Valerie takes advantage of an unexpected opportunity

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Gina risks her career to prove Donald is innocent when a woman is attacked in Victoria Park. Meanwhile, Jack uncovers important information in connection with the case of the missing boys, while Pratt experiences problems with a boy of his own. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring Jennie Jacques

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Property advice for a couple from a Coventry housing estate who are seeking an appropriate home in rural Devon with a Â£530,000 budget at their disposal. Plus, presenter Alistair Appleton learns about the county's maritime tradition when he meets a group of sea shanty singers

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Eric Knowles and Catherine Southon go head to head at a car boot sale in London, where they bid for bargains that can later be sold on for profit to be donated to their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Terry is angry with Nikki when she keeps Rosie off school to spend the day with her daughter - but that's just the start of her trouble-making as she sets her sights on one of Walford's attached men. Carol is upset that the grandchildren know about her illness and attends another hospital appointment alone, although she is grateful when an unexpected visitor turns up to support her. Tamwar goes to see Aleks about the stolen money - although the issue of whether he still has a job pales into insignificance when Fat Boy delivers a few home truths - and Johnny finally gives in to Linda's pestering and invites Whitney over for dinner

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Sacha continues to put his students through a punishing teaching schedule, Arthur begins to let his Doctor of the Year award go to his head, so Dominic plans to take his rival down a peg or two - and he gets the perfect chance when the pair of them are assigned to the same case. Serena is furious at being sent to cover AAU, but when an intriguing patient presents a business opportunity, she thinks she may have finally found a way to prove her worth to Guy. Jonny feels left out when Jac steams ahead with her plans for Emma

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An air stewardess makes her last flight when she is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture 2014
programme.desc: Christine Lagarde, the first woman to head the International Monetary Fund, delivers the 38th annual lecture in memory of broadcaster Richard Dimbleby, in which she explains her thoughts on the challenges facing the global economy. Introduced by David Dimbleby from the Guildhall in London

programme.title: Away from Her (2006)
programme.desc: An elderly woman with Alzheimer's disease is adamant she will move into a care home to spare her husband of 50 years the burden of looking after her. Sadly, this leaves him in the heartbreaking position of having to watch helplessly as his beloved wife slips away from him. Drama, based on a short story by Alice Munro, starring Gordon Pinsent, Julie Christie, Olympia Dukakis and Alberta Watson

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with the Armes family one year after their trial week in Auckland. Amanda did not initially share her husband's enthusiasm to emigrate, so the presenter discovers whether the lifestyle New Zealand had to offer eventually led to them making a permanent move

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a house in Derby, a former church in west London and a three-bedroom semi in Gretna, Dumfries and Galloway. They also follow the properties' sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers help a customer who paid thousands of pounds for a second-hand BMW that turned out to be faulty, while Marc and Tony visit an estate agents in London that took a deposit of Â£1,200 for a flat - yet never handed over the keys

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright explores the case of a father who claimed he was dumped by his wife and left with their newborn baby, only for fraud investigators to discover all was not as it seemed. Plus, the story of a man who struggled to find work after leaving school and faced the prospect of signing-on when his apprenticeship fell through

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams visit an antiques fair in Newark, Nottinghamshire, to search for items to sell at auction, with Chris Gower and Anita Manning on hand to provide guidance. Presented by Tim Wonnacott

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Love is in the air as Chris helps to supervise a basketball game at the youth club. Meanwhile, Al becomes intrigued by a teenage girl and her concerned mother, and Zara worries about Daniel. Medical drama, guest starring Tina O'Brien (Coronation Street)

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Despite Fenton's threat, Gina risks everything to prove Donald's innocence. Meanwhile, as William Parker is laid to rest, Jack has his eyes on a potential new suspect, and an attack at the cafe puts an officer's life in danger. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring Jennie Jacques and Kieran Bew

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family of six with a Â£360,000 budget find a rural home in Somerset. Away from the house-hunt, he visits the historic SS Great Britain ship in Bristol

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Eric Knowles goes up against Catherine Southon at the Mellors & Kirk auctioneers in Nottingham. Both experts bid for bargains that can be sold at a profit, competing to make the most money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The long-awaited school camp finally arrives but it seems some of the pupils and staff have ulterior motives for going. Hector uses the cover of the woods to find time alone with Nikki, pulling out all the stops to impress her - despite her recent engagement to Vix - and Gabriella causes chaos with another stunt. Back in the classroom, Christine is forced to confront her feelings for George, but she doesn't help matters by suggesting his new girlfriend Carol is a gold-digger

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Family fun and games with the Brockmans, as Sue has an ongoing battle with a printer that seems to have a mind of its own, while Ben becomes fascinated by the world of psychology. Karen is competing in a swimming competition, but taking it a little too seriously for her parents' liking, and Jake is only too eager to tell his mum and dad where they have failed in their daughter's upbringing. Claire Skinner, Hugh Dennis, Tyger Drew-Honey, Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez star

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is upset that Trevor has decided to work for a mission project in Africa, and resolves to give him an unforgettable send-off to remind him of the loving family he has in Ireland. Cathy's family counselling session descends into chaos, Buster and Dermot land themselves in trouble because of a circus lion, and neighbour Winnie is delighted that her husband's libido has returned. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ex-rugby union international Martyn Williams, former Olympic athlete Iwan Thomas, motor racing driver Mark Webber and Winter Olympic skeleton champion Amy Williams join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman and Danny Leigh provide their thoughts on the latest big-screen releases. Up for discussion are the reboot of 1987 sci-fi favourite RoboCop, with Gary Oldman, Dallas Buyers Club, starring Matthew McConaughey as 1980s Aids activist Ron Woodroof, and Ralph Fiennes' The Invisible Woman, which tells the story of Charles Dickens' extramarital affair

programme.title: The Matador (2005)
programme.desc: A lonely, burnt-out assassin strikes up an unlikely friendship with a down-on-his-luck businessman he meets in a Mexican bar. However, as the hitman's personal crises interfere with his work, he is forced to turn to his new friend to help him carry out a killing. Black comedy, starring Pierce Brosnan, Greg Kinnear and Hope Davis

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nikki Chapman returns one year on to discover whether the Haroon family moved to Australia after spending a trial week in Perth. Harry Haroon dreamed of joining the country's police force, but his wife Nabeela was reluctant to leave their family in the UK

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former office block in Folkestone, Kent, which has been converted into flats, a three-bedroom semi-detached home in Willaston, Cheshire, and a mid-terraced property in Edmonton, London. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go to a London guitar store to recover money on behalf of a client, while sheriffs Pete and Dave deal with the case of a parking officer who was dismissed from his job and denied the payment he was entitled to

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright looks at the cases of Peter Nicholson, Newham Council's former head of the Youth Offending Team, who received an OBE but was later jailed for stealing money, and a veterinary nurse who feared having to give up work to stay with her young daughter when she showed signs of developmental delay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and Thomas Plant join two teams to compete at an antiques fair on Wetherby Racecourse, West Yorkshire, before selling their purchases at auction. Plus, presenter Tim Wonnacott learns about 18th-century hellraiser James Pennyman during a visit to Ormesby Hall, near Middlesbrough

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen is fascinated by a glamorous socialite who arrives in Letherbridge with a hidden agenda. Heston is left to face an emotional Valerie, while Fliss returns to see Al and has a serious request. Medical drama, starring Jan Pearson and Owen Brenman

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Jack gets nearer to finding the other missing boy, and the hunt for Eddie's attacker compromises Pratt's relationship with his son. Meanwhile, there is another rape, but this time the consequences are deadly, and Gina and Jack become closer following some trouble at home

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple on the cusp of retirement search for their perfect rural retreat in Herefordshire, with a budget of Â£400,000. The presenter also takes time out from the property search to visit a farm that produces a special blackcurrant liqueur

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques experts Eric Knowles and Catherine Southon cross the Channel to go head-to-head at the St Ouen flea market in Paris. They have a budget of Â£750 to spend on their goods before they return to the UK in the hope of selling them for as much profit as possible

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca is less than happy when Terry, feeling guilty after his treatment of Nikki, lets her stay for dinner before she leaves for Acapulco - and his ex soon shows her true colours when she offers David a proposition that would change his world. Will he accept? A drunken Masood turns up at Carol's, upset to discover she has cancer and angry she didn't think he could look after her, while Linda is excited at the thought of Johnny and Whitney getting together - horrifying her son when he realises his mum has not come to terms with his sexuality

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the fortunes of family-run retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards, as he battles his high-street competition. The company's biggest rival, Poundland, reduces all its prices by 3p in East Ham, so Chris retaliates by launching what he thinks is a surefire winner - the Â£1 bra. But will it really attract more shoppers? The boss also thinks he needs to cut back on staff to raise revenue to fund new shops, so he sends his cost-cutting expert back to the shop floor to see whether his plans would damage customer service

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: New series. It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour cabinet minister Tessa Jowell and Respect MP George Galloway

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and Alan Johnson take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They will be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public

programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with the Andrews family, who disagreed about moving to Perth in Western Australia. While Melanie wanted a new life overseas, husband Rob struggled with the thought of leaving his relatives behind. During a trial week Down Under, Rob's work prospects looked good and it seemed his wife's dream might be within reach. Two years on, they reveal whether they took the plunge and moved for good

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a two-bedroom house in Staffordshire, a flat in London and a property in Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, all of which were bought at auction

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The enforcement officers try to help a pharmacist who did not get paid for 12 weeks and are given the cold shoulder when they chase up a debt in Derbyshire. They also go back on the trail of a builder who received Â£4,000 from an 86-year-old woman for shoddy work on her roof

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Following a tip-off about forged French passports, Ealing Council uncovers a hidden stash of false identities, forged documents and Â£215,000 worth of fraudulent benefit claims. Matt Allwright also meets a woman who had to give up work to look after her 11-year-old grandson after the death of her daughter, but with money tight she is struggling to support him

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to the Norfolk showground to unearth three treasures in an hour with Â£300. On hand to lend their expertise are Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant, while Tim Wonnacott uncovers an oriental oddity

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Howard unexpectedly finds himself working with Barry Biglow to apprehend a Russian sleeper agent at large on the university campus. Meanwhile, Al supports Fliss, and Jimmi and Hermione find that being too similar has its downside

programme.desc: Gina's life is placed in danger when an attempt to lure the killer into a trap takes a deadly turn, while Jack makes a horrifying discovery about the criminal that could prove vital to his colleague's survival. Crime drama, starring Jennie Jacques and Kieran Bew. A new series begins on Monday

programme.desc: Alistair Appleton heads to Yorkshire to help a keen baker and his business-focused wife find a rural retreat on a budget of Â£350,000. The presenter scales the heights of York Minster and gets a preview of the restoration work being done to the building's stained-glass windows

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Eric Knowles and Catherine Southon face the antiques showdown, making purchases at four locations before selling at least half of them at auction. In their battle for premium profits and the coveted title of champion, the experts' nerves begin to show

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Chris Evans and Alex Jones present the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ex-rugby union international Martyn Williams, former Olympic athlete Iwan Thomas, motor racing driver Mark Webber and Winter Olympic skeleton champion Amy Williams join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol worries about her first chemotherapy appointment but insists on going alone, while Kat is buzzing with excitement about Alfie's return and heads off to meet him at a hotel - only to be left shell-shocked by an unexpected encounter along the way. Shabnam tries to help Masood get his life back on track, although when Tamwar sees him heading to the Vic it seems their father isn't so interested in helping himself, and he issues him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedians Lee Mack and Ruby Wax and Hairy Biker Dave Myers to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include Top Gear, new-age books and chunky chips

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Retired DI Frank Patterson presents the team with information regarding the getaway car used in a 30-year-old safety deposit-box robbery. They discover the former detective not only wants to convict the suspected thief of the heist and murder of his three colleagues, but also prove that a high-ranking officer was involved in the plot - jeopardising the future of Sandra's Ucos unit. Phil Daniels guest stars

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham's guests include British film star Gary Oldman, who appears in the remake of 1987 sci-fi movie RoboCop, and Simon Pegg's right-hand man Nick Frost, who is going it alone as a former salsa prodigy in the dance comedy Cuban Fury. The host also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of family-run retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards, as he battles his high-street competition. The company's biggest rival, Poundland, reduces all its prices by 3p in East Ham, so Chris retaliates by launching what he thinks is a surefire winner - the Â£1 bra. But will it really attract more shoppers? The boss also thinks he needs to cut back on staff to raise revenue to fund new shops, so he sends his cost-cutting expert back to the shop floor to see whether his plans would damage customer service

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Omnibus. A drunken Masood is mugged and ends up being looked after by Tamwar - but when Aleks arrives with the news about the market office burglary, things soon spiral out of control. Shirley is saddened to hear about Carol's illness, having suffered a cancer scare herself in the past, leading her to make an important phone call. Dexter tries his luck with Nancy, Terry sticks up for Bianca when Nikki oversteps the mark, and Linda is buoyed when she hears about Johnny and Whitney's pregnancy scare, unaware it is fake

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a two-bedroom house in Derby, a cottage in Kent and a semi-detached property in Cumbria, then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The enforcement officers attempt to evict squatters from a London pub, while a pair of sheriffs go after a holiday company that owes one of its former employees hundreds of pounds in unpaid wages

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets the fraud investigators searching for a woman they suspect of using different identities to work illegally in the UK and claim Â£180,000 in benefits. Plus, a mother finds out whether she is entitled to help to ensure her autistic son can live as independent a life as possible

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode's alphabetical journey through the BBC's food archives continues as he reaches the letter U. He highlights Heston Blumenthal's recipe for sail porridge and Nigel Slater's method for cooking a black pudding sausage roll

programme.title: Great British Garden Revival
programme.desc: Fourteen of the UK's leading TV gardeners try to turn Britain into a green-fingered nation once again, with more people having paved patios than those who have trees. In each programme, two presenters focus on an aspect about which they feel passionately and offer advice to viewers, beginning with Monty Don on wild flowers and Joe Swift's tips for front gardens

programme.title: Britain's Empty Homes
programme.desc: Joe Crowley meets Roy and Sue Zaman, who, along with their son Paul and his wife Laura, have bought a Methodist chapel in Wiltshire and plan to transform it into two homes. To give the family tips and inspiration, Joe introduces them to a couple who have successfully converted their chapel into a four-bedroom property

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Stephen Sackur talks to Omar Abdullah, Chief Minister of Jammu & Kashmir, a long disputed territory once described by former president Bill Clinton as the most dangerous place on Earth. In a special edition recorded in front of a live studio audience in the Indian capital Delhi, they discuss the prospect of the region becoming a place of peace, not conflict

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant meets members of a Liverpool photographic society that traces its roots back to Victorian photographer Francis Frith. He also visits one of the world's first shopping malls in Bolton, and discovers how Blackpool grew into one of Britain's favourite holiday destinations

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and Jonty Hearnden try to help Amanda and Gary Peters raise enough money to build an art studio for one of their relatives

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Remaining contestants Holly, Janet, Jo and Mary-Anne test their pastry-making skills in the next set of challenges. After serving mousse cake and iced fingers to judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, the cooks create a dough capable of being used in three types of pastry or croissant. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The presenters take a tour of the Irish Sea, visiting every country in the British Isles. Neil Oliver learns about the inventions developed on the Isle of Man, including the world's largest waterwheel. Alice Roberts receives tips for surviving quicksand in Morecambe Bay, Mark Horton observes the remains of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's final work in Liverpool, and Nicholas Crane discovers why Anglesey is the site of some of Britain's biggest earthquakes

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Scientists, climbers and wildlife film-makers explore the rainforests of Guyana, a former British colony in South America. Cameraman Gordon Buchanan finds giant otters almost as large as he is, canopy expert Justine Evans observes a family of red howler monkeys, and biologist Steve Backshall probes a habitat below a massive waterfall where frogs and freshwater crabs happily co-exist

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Barby and Catherine Southon visit Wolverhampton, where a 19th-century sampler is among items up for auction. Meanwhile, Paul Martin explores the history behind locally made enamel boxes

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his trip through Spain as he retraces journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. After sipping sherry in Jerez, he learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras on Spain's Costa del Sol, and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The four semi-finalists are each given the task of transforming a large front room in a Victorian Arts and Crafts house in the Birmingham suburb of Moseley, receiving an increased budget of Â£1,500. Tom Dyckhoff examines the history of the properties and the design movement they were part of, before judges Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood decide which two contenders will go through to the final

programme.title: Children's Emergency Rescue
programme.desc: A baby with a hole in her heart desperately needs surgery, but the nearest hospital is closed and nurse Jamie must keep his patient alive long enough to reach another unit 100 miles away. Documentary following a team of doctors and nurses caring for some of the UK's sickest children. Narrated by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: Bob hopes to defend his title of toupee wearer of the year, but the house rat runs off with his wig on the day of the awards and he offers a golden ticket to the person who can retrieve the hairpiece in time for the celebrations. Just as all seems lost, Bob realises the secret to finding it is hidden in an unexpected place. Cowboy Builders presenter Dominic Littlewood appears as himself

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: More aspiring entrepreneurs bid to win funding for their projects from the panel. A former Team GB triathlete pitches an innovative sports recovery drink, a tech-savvy hopeful presents his taxi-booking app and a London-based businessman raises some eyebrows with his bespoke male contraceptive. Evan Davis presents

programme.title: The Naked Rambler
programme.desc: Stephen Gough has been repeatedly arrested during attempts to walk from Land's End to John O'Groats without wearing clothes, and he has spent a total of almost seven years in Scottish prisons. This documentary follows the former Royal Marine as he sets out to trek naked more than 400 miles to his home in Eastleigh, Hampshire, on a four-month journey beset by run-ins with the police

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Music Technology
programme.desc: Radio 1 presenter Dev offers practical advice for making music with easy-to-access technology, combined with an exploration of musical and sonic principles and concepts. He learns how to set up a home studio with producer Kito, sample and loop with Happa, and Tim Exile demonstrates live production techniques. He also works on multi-track projects with Charlie Hugall and discovers the use of mobile music technology

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: A mix of dance and animation based on the four elements of fire, water, earth and air, specifically designed to introduce children with special education needs to classical music

programme.title: Schools - Play On!
programme.desc: Conclusion. Dan Starkey, Khalil Madovi, Danielle Peazer, Martin Dougan and Devin Griffin present an animated documentary introducing young viewers to the world of classical music. Works featured range from Modest Mussorgsky's Night on the Bare Mountain to HandsFree by Anna Meredith

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A short film featuring a display of monarch butterflies, known for their mass migrations that take millions of them to California and Mexico each winter

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a terraced property in Kent, a one-bedroom house in Carlisle, and a fire-damaged property in Derby, which are all about to be sold at auction. After the sale, they talk to the new owners about their plans for the houses, and check on their progress at a later date

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers help a pub landlord who paid Â£10,000 for wind turbines that did not work and try to recover money owed to a horse breeder. Plus, sheriff Pete has bad news for an aircraft company that has not paid its debts

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright examines the case of a woman who raised the suspicions of Oxford City Council when she returned to the UK and claimed benefits after living abroad for 30 years. He also meets the people who helped 84-year-old hospital patient Dorothy find a way to stay in her own home

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode reaches the letter V in his alphabetical journey through the BBC's culinary archive, highlighting Anjum Anand's vindaloo recipe from Indian Food Made Easy, and Sophie Dahl's tips on baking a Victoria sponge

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham returns to investigate another collection of unusual natural events, with the help of eyewitness accounts, input from scientists and illustrative footage. In this edition, peculiar behaviours include dogs that commute on the Moscow metro and deadly sharks at a golf course in Australia. Plus, a town that was inundated by vast amounts of tumbleweed and a wolverine frog thought to be capable of shooting bones through its skin

programme.title: Rip Off Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford unearths more tricks used by some food manufacturers and supermarkets, and the hidden rip-offs that could be lurking in the average consumer's fridge. She reveals the foods that promise top quality but deliver much less - including the cod that turned out to be Vietnamese catfish - and asks what really goes into a bottle of olive oil

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with two children aged 10 who are both hard of hearing and have been monitored by the programme since they were five. Yasin has a cochlear implant and is fully mainstreamed with English as his first language, while Lucy has grown up with deaf parents and siblings, and reveals her ambitions for success at the Deaflympics. With voiceover

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant continues his journey in the footsteps of Victorian photographer Francis Frith. He visits a remarkable steamship in the western Highlands that has been transporting passengers for more than a century, observes the restoration work carried out at Stirling Castle and tries his hand at traditional Scottish baking

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Angela Rippon and Jonty Hearnden visit Whitstable, where Wendy and David Warry are hoping to raise money for a pleasure flight over Kent

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls compete in the 2011 final, which sees them cooking for a street party attended by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, as well as friends, family and former Bake Off contestants. Their offerings include mille-feuille, mini Victoria sponges, and miniature strawberry and rhubarb cheesecakes. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores the legacy of black American GIs who came to Britain to prepare for D-Day. He also visits a coastal amphitheatre near Land's End, where he performs an extract from Shakespeare's The Tempest and learns how one woman's determination led to the venue's construction

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: The team travels deeper into the Guyanan jungle and scorpions and poisonous centipedes enter the base camp. Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forest's edge

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques gurus Jethro Marles and Mark Stacey lend their expertise in Eastbourne, while Paul Martin visits an artist who uses ancient techniques to produce contemporary works

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy on the first leg of a journey from Turin to Venice. He recreates a scene from classic film The Italian Job on a historic Fiat test track and follows fashion in Milan, before boarding a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: It's the final and each of the two remaining contenders is given four rooms of a Georgian house in Liverpool to transform on a budget of Â£4,400. They have 72 hours to complete the task, and have the added help of two builders and a decorator. Tom Dyckhoff explores the history of the homes, before judges Daniel Hopwood and Sophie Robinson decide who will walk off with the title. Last in the series

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: Russell Norman comes to the aid of a couple who sank all their savings into a run-down village inn in Selsley, Gloucestershire, with the intention of turning it into a gastropub. Owner Dave is trying to run several businesses as well as his farm, while his partner Debbie has a high-powered job in management, and the pair think they can keep the new venture ticking over in their spare time. As the all-important opening night fast approaches, the menu, service and staffing seem to be an afterthought and there is trouble in the kitchen

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining what impact the relationships between cousins Nicholas II of Russia, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and George V of the United Kingdom had on the outbreak of the First World War. This episode focuses on the story of the emerging divisions and rivalries between the inter-related royal houses of Europe during the 19th century. Featuring contributions by historians Karina Urbach, Miranda Carter and Piers Brendon. Tamsin Greig narrates. Concludes tomorrow

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: New series. Anthology of darkly comic tales written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with each exploring what is going on behind the door of a different residence. The guests arrive for Rebecca and Jeremy's engagement party, but one of the bedrooms - the one with all their old baggage in it - has been left unlocked. With Katherine Parkinson, Timothy West, Anne Reid, Anna Chancellor and Julian Rhind-Tutt

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with two children aged 10 who are both hard of hearing and have been monitored by the programme since they were five. Yasin has a cochlear implant and is fully mainstreamed with English as his first language, while Lucy has grown up with deaf parents and siblings, and reveals her ambitions for success at the Deaflympics. With voiceover

programme.title: Imagine - Edmund de Waal
programme.desc: Ceramicist Edmund de Waal is perhaps best known as the author of The Hare with Amber Eyes, a family memoir that sold 1.5 million copies worldwide. But despite his success as a writer, he is first and foremost a potter, having made his first piece at the age of five. Alan Yentob follows Edmund for a year as he prepares to exhibit in New York for the first time and also researches his next book, a globe-spanning search for the meaning of white, through the world of porcelain

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - Howard Goodall's Story of Music
programme.desc: The composer examines the history and development of music, beginning by looking back at the first faltering steps humanity took toward creating it. He considers archaeological evidence showing that music was as important in the late Stone Age as it is now and charts how Gregorian chant started with a handful of monks singing the same tune in unison. Over the course of several centuries, medieval musicians painstakingly put together the basics of what has become termed harmony and then added rhythm - the building blocks of the music the world enjoys today

programme.title: Schools - Bringing Books to Life
programme.desc: The series touches on the range of reading experiences available to young people between the ages of seven and 10, as some of the best children's books are explored

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A short film revealing the way flamingos move around to display their long necks in a courtship ritual

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a house in Derby, a former church in west London and a three-bedroom semi in Gretna, Dumfries and Galloway. They also follow the properties' sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers help a customer who paid thousands of pounds for a second-hand BMW that turned out to be faulty, while Marc and Tony visit an estate agents in London that took a deposit of Â£1,200 for a flat - yet never handed over the keys

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright explores the case of a father who claimed he was dumped by his wife and left with their newborn baby, only for fraud investigators to discover all was not as it seemed. Plus, the story of a man who struggled to find work after leaving school and faced the prospect of signing-on when his apprenticeship fell through

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode reaches the letter W in his alphabetical journey through the BBC's culinary archive, highlighting Rick Stein's potato and watercress soup, and the Hairy Bikers' white chocolate cheesecake

programme.title: Italy Unpacked
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon and Giorgio Locatelli embark on a fresh tour of the country, this time travelling down the west coast. They begin in Liguria - a region whose rugged mountains and rocky coastline once inspired English poets of the Romantic era. The pair visit Genoa, where opulent Baroque palaces and celebrated Van Dyke and Strozzi paintings reflect its past as a great maritime republic, before heading on to Cinque Terre - meaning `five lands' - to navigate the scattered villages by boat. Finally, Tuscany beckons the duo, who conclude this leg of their trip by exploring Pistoia, Pisa and Livorno

programme.title: Rip Off Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford unearths more tricks used by some food manufacturers and supermarkets, and the hidden rip-offs that could be lurking in the average consumer's fridge. She compares tap and bottled water to see which comes out on top and investigates the real price of pre-prepared vegetables. Plus, the special offers that may not be quite what they seem. Last in the series

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Stephen Sackur talks to people making the headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The day's political news, interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant's journey continues along the north-east coast of England and begins in Hartlepool, Co Durham, where he searches for a missing rock formation. He then heads to North Yorkshire, visiting Saltburn-by-the-Sea and ending his trip in Whitby, where he meets the descendants of a family photographed by Francis Frith

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and the team head to Essex, where they hope to help widow Mary Miller clear out a lifetime of collectibles. She wants to raise the funds, along with her close friend Jan, for a special trip

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First of two episodes in which the programme's judges give baking masterclasses from the second series. Mary Berry prepares a coffee and walnut Battenberg, a tarte au citron and brandy snaps, and Paul Hollywood creates a traditional Italian flatbread

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores Brittany in northern France, where he meets a lighthouse keeper immortalised in a famous photograph and the last survivors of a French Resistance effort during the Second World War. Nick Crane joins the onion sellers who have delivered their products around the countryside and provided the stereotypical image of the Frenchman for the past 200 years, while Alice Roberts reveals how iodine was discovered. Mark Horton investigates the standing stones at Carnac and Miranda Krestovnikoff dives for a seafood treat

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo. Last in the series

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits one of the UK's most famous boxing clubs, before joining Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon as they value antiques in Watford

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey through Italy. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: In February last year, Jeff Bush was asleep at his home in Florida when a sink hole opened up beneath his bedroom. Despite the efforts of his brother to rescue him, Jeff was never seen alive again and his body could not be recovered. Professor Iain Stewart travels to the American state to discover what took Jeff's life and investigate why the geology of the area makes it the sinkhole capital of the world

programme.title: Restoration Home One Year On
programme.desc: Kieran Long revisits Bill and Kim, who turned a crumbling building into a dream holiday home when they started an ambitious architectural transformation of their 16th-century farmhouse in Monmouthshire, with the aid of joiner Sam Thomas. Kieran then heads to Norfolk, where Polly and Eric's attempt to restore the 16th-century Grade II-listed Old Manor had seen them run out of money with little more to show than a crumbling timber skeleton. He discovers what has happened since and how Polly feels about the building into which she sank her life savings. Last in the series

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part two of two. The documentary examines the key role played by royalty in smoothing the path to the Anglo-Russian entente of 1907, and the part played by the Kaiser's erratic, unstable personality in the growing isolation of Germany in the years leading up to 1914. The film also explores the roles played by the German, British and Russian monarchs in the months leading up to the outbreak of the First World War and tells the story of George V's refusal to grant his cousin Nicholas II asylum in England following the Russian Revolution of 1917

programme.title: Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe
programme.desc: The writer and broadcaster offers a satirical look at the latest news from politics, the media and the internet, casting a critical eye over trends in TV, cinema, computer games and social media. Plus, regular commentators Philomena and Barry give their own unique takes on the week's biggest stories. With Diane Morgan and Al Campbell

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Don't Panic - The Truth About Population
programme.desc: Statistician Hans Rosling uses state-of-the-art 3D graphics to paint a portrait of a quickly changing world, arguing that the problems of rapid population growth and extreme poverty are beginning to be conquered. Families of two children are now the norm and a smaller proportion of people live in extreme poverty than ever before. Rosling uses an `ignorance survey' to demonstrate how British university graduates would be outperformed by chimpanzees in a test of knowledge about developing countries. Part of the This World strand

programme.title: Educating North Korea - Panorama
programme.desc: A visit to North Korea, revealing a university in the heart of the dictatorship where the sons of the brutal regime are being educated. Chris Rogers spends time on campus to meet the secretive state's future elite

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon investigates ancient routes and shrines across Europe that are still being used, trying to find out whether modern pilgrims are motivated by religious devotion or a sense of adventure. In the French town of St Omer, he finds piles of shoes left on the tomb of a 7th-century saint with notes pleading for children to be cured of their walking difficulties. Simon also visits the Way of St James, a 500-mile route that starts in the French town of St Jean-Pied-du-Port, crosses the Pyrenees, winds through northern Spain and finishes in the holy city of Santiago de Compostela

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - The Charles Dickens Show
programme.desc: Educational programme in which Charles Dickens hosts a chat show. In this edition, he is joined by Thomas Barnardo to discuss the Victorian phenomenon of the workhouse, speaking to an orphan who has lived in one for two years and finding out what a typical menu for the inhabitants would be

programme.title: Schools - The Charles Dickens Show
programme.desc: Educational programme in which Charles Dickens hosts a chat show exploring the issue of health in the Victorian era. The author is joined by Mary Seacole and Florence Nightingale, while Joseph Lister takes on the medical establishment in Ask the Doctors. With a report on cholera from John Snow

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The author discusses the issue of child labour with reforming peer Lord Shaftesbury, takes questions from ragged schoolchildren and interviews a disreputable factory owner. Plus, a report on youngsters plying their trades on the streets of London

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Scientist George McGavin helps young people learn more about the processes of rot and decay, and explains the roles they play in the natural world. He investigates the life-cycle of flies, finding out how they play an important part in the natural process of recycling, and analyses microscopic time-lapsed footage of rot

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A short film capturing the ways in which ants work together as a team to carry blades of grass back to their colony

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former office block in Folkestone, Kent, which has been converted into flats, a three-bedroom semi-detached home in Willaston, Cheshire, and a mid-terraced property in Edmonton, London. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go to a London guitar store to recover money on behalf of a client, while sheriffs Pete and Dave deal with the case of a parking officer who was dismissed from his job and denied the payment he was entitled to

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright looks at the cases of Peter Nicholson, Newham Council's former head of the Youth Offending Team, who received an OBE but was later jailed for stealing money, and a veterinary nurse who feared having to give up work to stay with her young daughter when she showed signs of developmental delay

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode embarks on an alphabetical journey through dishes prepared by an array of TV chefs

programme.title: Cold War, Hot Jets
programme.desc: Part two of two. James Holland explores how the escalating tensions between the superpowers of America and the Soviet Union in the 1950s and 60s led to the jet bomber coming to define how the Cold War was fought. Britain's V-force aircraft were able to fly faster, higher and further than ever before, and were armed with nuclear weapons

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour cabinet minister Tessa Jowell and Respect MP George Galloway

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant travels to Derbyshire, where he visits Francis Frith's home town of Chesterfield and ascends the famous twisted spire. He also explores a medieval country house near Bakewell and enjoys a flutter at the races in Nottingham. Last in the series

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Fiona Inglis, mother of Blue singer Duncan James, invites Lorne Spicer and John Cameron to help her raise enough money to treat her best friend to a day out in London

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry conclude their baking masterclasses, providing recipes and tips to prepare pork pies filled with pork loin and quail's egg, as well as chocolate roulade, traditional iced fingers and Sachertorte

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: An exploration of the history and culture of some of the most extreme locations in Britain. Nick Crane visits the Isles of Scilly, Ruth Goodman walks the dangerous path traversed daily by the Branscombe Cliff farmers in Devon, and Mark Horton investigates the Transatlantic Telegraph service. Meanwhile, Hermione Cockburn learns how the fossil of a large sea creature found at St David's Head, Pembrokeshire, shaped scientists' understanding of Earth's history

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics Opening Ceremony
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces coverage from the Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, Russia, where a spectacular choreographed show signals the official beginning of the XXII Olympic Winter Games. Over the next 16 days, the world's finest will gather in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana to compete in 15 sports in front of a huge global audience, as they aim to write themselves into the history books as another chapter of the Olympic story is written. The event builds to the lighting of the Olympic Flame, which has been into space as part of its journey, as Russia hosts the Winter Games for the first occasion in their history. Hazel Irvine leads the commentary team. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Steered by his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo explores Germany and learns how tourists in the early 20th century would have been visiting a relatively new country, which they admired and envied but also feared. He learns about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to take their place in the black chair, where they answer questions on the snooker world championship from 1977 to the present date, the musicals of Alan Jay Lerner and Frederick Loewe, the novels of American mystery writer Cara Black, and 16th-century monarch Phillip II of Spain. They then have a chance to demonstrate their general knowledge in the final round

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: It is a busy time for many as Easter approaches, with Jo Birch getting popular attraction La Seigneurie Gardens ready for the start of the tourist season. Shepherd Dave Scott is bracing himself for the onset of lambing and Bas needs to get his fishing boat painted in time, but a blizzard and a force-nine gale throw many plans into disarray

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day in 1984, British ice-dancing pair Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean skated into the record books when their routine to music from Ravel's Bolero received the highest set of marks ever awarded, including nine perfect scores of 6 for artistic impression. This documentary tells the story of the performance, with contributions by Torvill and Dean

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: New series. The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi, celebrating what makes the Games special

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Passchendaele (2008)
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol

programme.title: Daybreak
programme.desc: Morning show featuring news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features, presented by Matt Barbet, Ranvir Singh, Lorraine Kelly and Aled Jones

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Actress Cate Blanchett talks to host Lorraine Kelly about starring alongside George Clooney and Matt Damon in new film The Monuments Men, and actor Joe McFadden discusses joining the cast of Holby City. Plus, entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. Including at 11.25 ITV News and Regional Weather

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest Ross Kemp chats to panellists Kaye Adams, Myleene Klass, Janet Street-Porter and Linda Robson about his new series of Extreme World, plus all the usual topical debates from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and antiques experts Corrie Jeffery and David Hakeney head to Ludlow in Shropshire, where they appraise items brought in by members of the public including an eastern style vase, a vintage horse racing game and a charm bracelet

programme.title: The Alan Titchmarsh Show
programme.desc: Comedy actress Anna Chancellor and pet experts the Barking Blondes join the green-fingered host in the studio for chat, music, features and a look at some of the country's unsung heroes

programme.title: ITV London Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Britain's Best Bakery
programme.desc: Three diverse London establishments go head to head, as they are challenged to make piped orange Viennese biscuits for judges Peter Sidwell and Mich Turner. Taking part are a pair of flamboyant Americans, a Turkish Cypriot and a French pattissiere

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.desc: Chris Tarrant hosts the last-ever edition of the long-running quiz, inviting a final three pairs of famous faces to take the hot seat. Aiming to raise as much cash as possible for their chosen charities and one lucky viewer are funnyman Dom Joly and actor James Nesbitt, Hairy Biker Dave Myers with Countdown maths whizz Rachel Riley, and comedian Kevin Bridges with Olympic cycling hero Chris Hoy. programme.title: Births, Deaths and Marriages
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary following people recording landmark moments of love and loss at Britain's most famous register office, Old Marylebone Town Hall in central London. programme.title: FA Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Fulham v Sheffield United. Action from the fourth-round replay at Craven Cottage, where the Blades were aiming to produce an upset. The League One side claimed a 1-1 draw at Bramall Lane despite captain Michael Doyle's 52nd-minute sending off, but Premier League outfit Fulham will have expected to take the honours in front of their own fans and earn a home fifth-round tie against Nottingham Forest or Preston North End, who meet in tomorrow night's fourth-round replay

programme.title: Jimmy White
programme.desc: A profile of the snooker player, who reached six World Championship finals during the 1980s and 90s, but failed to win any of them, yet became hugely popular with the public for his `whirlwind' style of play. As reporter Adam Darke reveals, away from the baize White has also appeared in several TV shows, including the 2009 series of I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here and the snooker-based game show Big Break. An excited Lloyd prepares for his date with Andrea, while Gloria makes digs at Rita during a meeting with Dennis and Ritchie

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Nelson discover that the exciting world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets after the owner of Finchmere Airfield is hit on the head and dropped to his death from a plane. Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee are joined by guest stars including June Whitfield, Robert Bathurst, Bernard Cribbins and Laila Rouass

programme.desc: At a meal to celebrate Georgia's return from Canada, Priya makes her excuses and leaves her food, leading to a confrontation with a suspicious Leyla. programme.title: Who Wants to Work Forever?
programme.desc: Large numbers in the UK are failing to save enough money for a comfortable retirement, and with an increase to the age at which people become eligible for the state pension, many face a future of working well into their golden years. Fiona Foster looks at some of the ways in which people are extending their careers and examines the scale of the pension crisis

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Priya takes a plate of food upstairs and tries to force herself to eat it, while Leyla shares her concerns with Alicia, who then tells David - but warns him not to go blundering in. programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon's estranged husband Chris gets in touch asking for a divorce so he can marry his new girlfriend Angie, but Tracey has her doubts. Later, at the happy couple's engagement party, Dorien meets a handsome blind man who takes a shine to her. Sitcom, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.desc: New series. The current-affairs documentary goes inside the sweatshops of Bangladesh to investigate the hidden face of the fashion trade. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Moira and James are excited about the possibility of landing a new contract, while Cain races to the hotel where they are staying, having heard from Dan that James has feelings for his sister-in-law. Priya finds herself in hospital after experiencing stomach pains, Brenda has an overwhelming urge to steal and Bernice tells Nicola and Marlon to remove her online dating profile

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle is upset to hear an envious Steve moaning about Lloyd and Andrea's relationship, while Anna rounds on Phelan when he turns up at the yard and brands him a lying conman - putting the whole deal in jeopardy. Rob admits to Carla that he wants Tracy back, and Stella orders Gloria to stop leading Dennis on. Meanwhile, Sophie tells Tim she knows it was Maddie who broke into No 4 and hit him

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: Martin Lewis and Saira Khan make some huge savings by haggling down prices on package holidays, and reveal how to get a good deal on hire cars abroad. The reclaim store also returns as Martin demonstrates how to get back payment-protection insurance for free. Last in the series

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: After Michelle forces Steve to sleep on the sofa, he makes his feelings clear to Andrea - but will she reveal her own? Anna is on edge when the Phelans join her and Owen in the Rovers, while Tracy fears she may have pushed Rob too far after he berates her for selling his possessions. Sophie tells Tim she thinks about Maddie all the time, and Dennis is furious to discover Ritchie has invited Gloria for a night on the town

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The veteran DJ, currently celebrating 50 years in broadcasting, looks back on his life and career, which included launching Radio 1 in 1967 and, more recently, being banned from the airwaves for playing Cliff Richard records. Tony talks about how he became addicted to Valium following the breakdown of his first marriage to actress Tessa Wyatt. Other revelations include romping with a girlfriend in Frank Sinatra's London flat and saving fellow DJ Kenny Everett's life

The film follows 23-year-old James Kingston as he tackles radio towers in Southampton, before travelling to the spiritual home of urban free-climbing - Ukraine - where he teams up with the infamous climber Mustang Wanted to push himself further than ever, culminating in Mustang's latest death-defying stunt on Moscow Bridge in Kiev

programme.title: Don't Look Down
programme.desc: Documentary exploring one of the world's most dangerous and terrifying new crazes - urban free-climbing - where daredevils scale cranes and buildings without safety equipment and hang hundreds of feet above the ground, one slip from certain death. The film follows 23-year-old James Kingston as he tackles radio towers in Southampton, before travelling to the spiritual home of urban free-climbing - Ukraine - where he teams up with the infamous climber Mustang Wanted to push himself further than ever, culminating in Mustang's latest death-defying stunt on Moscow Bridge in Kiev

As the band rise to success in the post-punk era of the late 1970s, Curtis struggles with the pressures of fame, a failing marriage, uncontrollable epilepsy and an affair with a Belgian journalist. Based on the book Touching from a Distance by Curtis' wife Deborah, and starring Sam Riley and Samantha Morton

programme.title: She's 78, He's 39
programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: New series. The drama about an NYPD team specialising in sexual crimes returns. Mackenzie Burton disappears from her family home while her mother Pam is taking a bath and when Benson and Stabler investigate, they can find no sign of forced entry. The girl's father tells them that Mackenzie was adopted and also reveals that he and his wife's biological daughter Ella was abducted 10 years previously - a case that remains unsolved. Guest starring Joan Cusack, Peter Strauss and Henry Ian Cusick

programme.title: Body of Proof

programme.desc: Real-life stories of bravery and heroism, including the skateboarders who rescued a woman, her sons and two cats from a burning first-floor flat, the shop owner who defended his store from armed robbers and a group of people who pulled a motorcyclist from under a burning car. There is also footage of the Cockermouth floods of 2009, the story of a humpback whale trapped in fishermen's nets in the Sea of Cortez, and contributions from members of the emergency services, who discuss some of their most dramatic cases

programme.title: Ultimate Emergency Bikers
programme.desc: In Birmingham, paramedic Steve Cooper makes a surprising discovery after going to the aid of a woman sleeping rough who is at risk of hypothermia, and there is a remarkable escape for a driver whose van is impaled on railings just outside Moor Street station. Biker cop Smithy tries to work out how a driver hit a horse in North Yorkshire, while Lucy Watson gets more than she bargained for in Cornwall when she deals with a lorry driver who reeks of booze

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New series. The aftermath of Harper Dearing's bomb attack on the NCIS headquarters dominates proceedings. As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: Documentary using interviews, dramatic reconstruction and archive footage to examine the impact and legacy of Arthur Conan Doyle's fictional detective Sherlock Holmes, as well as looking at the inspiration behind the literary sleuth. Forensic scientists, crime historians and experts in all things Holmesian reveal how Sherlock's methods became a catalyst in the evolution of modern investigative techniques, with Dr Henry Lee showing how he used blood evidence to clear a woman charged with the murder of her husband in Florida

programme.title: The Big Benefits Row

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits a struggling hotel and nightclub in Essex run by members of the Dolbear family, who spend more time arguing than looking after their customers' needs. She soon detects a battle of the sexes, with father and son Jeff and Andy shouting down mum and daughter Marilyn and Shelley when it comes to decision-making. The garish decor does not help - and to top it off, Jeff remains blind to the business's problems. Alex discovers the rest of the family called her in against his wishes, and he now says he will ignore all her advice

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The crusading lawyer takes on a custody case, only for his client to later confess to having murdered the psychiatrist who testified against him.
