programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: New series. Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it five years ago, but such expectations have yet to be realised

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Rita Lowman is trapped in a lift as its ceiling catches fire and is burned alive, with security footage proving that arsonist Leonard Brooks tampered with the machinery. When a man dies after eating a sandwich spiked with a substance that causes a fiery chemical reaction with his stomach acid, Mac and the team must find the connection between the victims before Brooks strikes again. Crime drama, guest starring Rob Morrow, with Gary Sinise and Natalie Martinez

Starring Gary Sinise and Sela Ward

programme.desc: An unhappily married vet wonders how her life would have changed if she had made different decisions in the past. When she is called out to treat a dog that may have to be put down, she discovers the owner is an old friend from her university days, only adding to her emotional turmoil. Drama, starring Kirstie Alley, Bill Smitrovich, Peter Horton and Janaya Stephens. Edited for violence and language

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A look at the origins of the sci-fi show created by Gene Roddenberry in the 1960s, which spawned four TV spin-offs and a movie franchise. Featuring interviews with the producer of the original series Herb Solow, Roddenberry's son Rod, star Leonard Nimoy (Mr Spock) and fan club members Bjo and John Trimble, the film charts Roddenberry's rise to fame and how he went to extraordinary lengths to keep his creation on air

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. A diver narrates his own shocking footage of a great white shark breaking open his cage with its jaws. A giant anaconda sinks its teeth into a Brazilian policeman, an agitated elephant charges a honeymooning British couple on an African safari and a lion turns on its handler at an awards ceremony. Plus, chimpanzees on the loose in Northern Ireland and a frightening incident at a bullring

programme.title: Criminals

Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others

Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

The girl's father tells them that Mackenzie was adopted and also reveals that he and his wife's biological daughter Ella was abducted 10 years previously - a case that remains unsolved. Guest starring Joan Cusack, Peter Strauss and Henry Ian Cusick

programme.desc: Real-life stories of bravery and heroism, including the skateboarders who rescued a woman, her sons and two cats from a burning first-floor flat, the shop owner who defended his store from armed robbers and a group of people who pulled a motorcyclist from under a burning car. There is also footage of the Cockermouth floods of 2009, the story of a humpback whale trapped in fishermen's nets in the Sea of Cortez, and contributions from members of the emergency services, who discuss some of their most dramatic cases

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New series. The aftermath of Harper Dearing's bomb attack on the NCIS headquarters dominates proceedings. As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: Documentary using interviews, dramatic reconstruction and archive footage to examine the impact and legacy of Arthur Conan Doyle's fictional detective Sherlock Holmes, as well as looking at the inspiration behind the literary sleuth. Forensic scientists, crime historians and experts in all things Holmesian reveal how Sherlock's methods became a catalyst in the evolution of modern investigative techniques, with Dr Henry Lee showing how he used blood evidence to clear a woman charged with the murder of her husband in Florida

programme.title: The Big Benefits Row
programme.desc: A panel discusses the UK's welfare system and why the subject has become such a political hot potato, with questions and contributions by a studio audience. Topics covered include whether the process is being abused and if it should be made harder for the long-term unemployed and recent immigrants to claim benefits

programme.title: Poker

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which Ben Fogle meets people who have moved to inhospitable parts of the world after leaving the rat race behind. He begins by travelling to the swamplands of southern Georgia in America to spend time with 64-year-old Colbert, a former financier who now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin. Ben learns some of the vital skills needed to survive in this dangerous backwater, including skinning roadkill, spearing frogs and drinking swamp water

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers in Cotham, Bristol, whose four-bedroom bungalow has been on the market for four months. She suggests revamping the shabby sitting room to enhance its ambience and updating the mismatched kitchen with a lick of paint, tile jewellery and new flooring, before turning her attention to sprucing up the two bathrooms

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice visits a bungalow in Hove that appears to be deterring potential buyers with its lurid colour scheme

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Cambridge academic Paul Binski continues his fact-finding journey through the history of religious art, visiting St Giles in Cheadle, Staffordshire, and the Free Church in Glasgow to see how Augustus Pugin and Alexander 'Greek' Thomson, two notable Victorian architects, rejected the prevailing industrialism of their era and drew inspiration from the grandeur of the past

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits a struggling hotel and nightclub in Essex run by members of the Dolbear family, who spend more time arguing than looking after their customers' needs. She soon detects a battle of the sexes, with father and son Jeff and Andy shouting down mum and daughter Marilyn and Shelley when it comes to decision-making. The garish decor does not help - and to top it off, Jeff remains blind to the business's problems. Alex discovers the rest of the family called her in against his wishes, and he now says he will ignore all her advice

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Dex assumes control of the wedding preparations when he and April are unable to agree on a best man or a maid of honour. Spencer finds Jett and Nina and persuades them to come home, while Casey and Tamara realise their relationship is at a crossroads and agree to go their separate ways

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: It's the day of Josh's Commonwealth Games trials and tension builds as everyone gathers at the Turners' house to watch him in action - but things get off to a shaky start for the swimmer. Meanwhile, Kyle finally asks Kate out on a date and Sonya wrestles with her conscience as she considers telling Toadie the truth about Jacob

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The crusading lawyer takes on a custody case, only for his client to later confess to having murdered the psychiatrist who testified against him. However, when McBride shows up at the doctor's house, the body is nowhere to be found. Mystery directed by and starring John Larroquette, with Marta DuBois, Matt Lutz and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: NewsTalk Live
programme.desc: Topical debate and in-depth analysis of the day's major stories, with experts discussing the key talking points of the issues making the headlines and viewers also having the chance to give their opinions. Presented by Emma Crosby

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: New series. Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it five years ago, but such expectations have yet to be realised

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Rita Lowman is trapped in a lift as its ceiling catches fire and is burned alive, with security footage proving that arsonist Leonard Brooks tampered with the machinery. When a man dies after eating a sandwich spiked with a substance that causes a fiery chemical reaction with his stomach acid, Mac and the team must find the connection between the victims before Brooks strikes again. Crime drama, guest starring Rob Morrow, with Gary Sinise and Natalie Martinez

programme.title: Access

programme.title: SuperCasino

programme.title: She's 78, He's 39
programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jon puts his body on the line as he tackles a drunken youth in a domestic dispute and Martin turns detective to catch a drink-driver who thinks she can get one over on the interceptors. Elsewhere, a speeding motorist causes chaos after crashing into a gas main, Doug gets to grips with a burglar and the hunt is on for Lincoln's answer to Harry Houdini. Documentary following the work of Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: April forces Casey and Tamara into serving as best man and maid of honour, unaware of their decision to split up, and also gets good news from Paris. programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amber fears for the future when she discovers Josh will be spending three months at a training camp in Spain - and starts making plans to join him abroad. programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: An unidentified woman found dead in an alleyway appears to have taken a heroin overdose, but further inspection reveals someone may have had a hand in administering the fatal drugs. Mac recognises the victim as conspiracy-obsessed Tessa James, and as he works to explore whether there was truth in her stories, the investigation leads to an elite gentlemen's club that has traces of blood on the walls. Starring Gary Sinise and Sela Ward

programme.title: While I Was Gone (2004)
programme.desc: An unhappily married vet wonders how her life would have changed if she had made different decisions in the past. When she is called out to treat a dog that may have to be put down, she discovers the owner is an old friend from her university days, only adding to her emotional turmoil. Drama, starring Kirstie Alley, Bill Smitrovich, Peter Horton and Janaya Stephens. Edited for violence and language

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A look at the origins of the sci-fi show created by Gene Roddenberry in the 1960s, which spawned four TV spin-offs and a movie franchise. Featuring interviews with the producer of the original series Herb Solow, Roddenberry's son Rod, star Leonard Nimoy (Mr Spock) and fan club members Bjo and John Trimble, the film charts Roddenberry's rise to fame and how he went to extraordinary lengths to keep his creation on air

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: In Manitoba, Hugh Rowland and Rick Yemm negotiate slushy roads, a thawing river crossing and a low bridge in their search for the abandoned trailers. Alex Debogorski is delivering goods to the tiny hamlet of Tuktoyaktuk in the Northwest Territories, but to get there he has to make a risky journey across the frozen Arctic Ocean

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben journeys to the foothills of the Indian Himalayas to spend time with 69-year-old former fighter pilot Steve Lall, who has opted for a simple farmer's life in the mountains. Ben gets hands-on with the harsh subsistence lifestyle, ploughing with buffalo, chasing both monkeys and human intruders, and gravedigging

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. A diver narrates his own shocking footage of a great white shark breaking open his cage with its jaws. A giant anaconda sinks its teeth into a Brazilian policeman, an agitated elephant charges a honeymooning British couple on an African safari and a lion turns on its handler at an awards ceremony. Plus, chimpanzees on the loose in Northern Ireland and a frightening incident at a bullring

programme.title: Rules of Engagement

American sci-fi drama, starring Robbie Amell, Peyton List and Luke Mitchell

programme.title: Derren Brown
programme.desc: In this one-off special, the master illusionist and showman tries to pull off the perfect crime. He has bet renowned art collector Ivan Massow he can steal a painting from right under his nose. Derren reveals which work is being targeted - a piece by Turner-nominated British brothers Jake and Dinos Chapman - and tells Ivan exactly what time the theft will happen. He even provides a photograph of the person who is going to take it. In a bid to pull off the heist, he recruits a crew - not of career criminals or cat burglars - but of pensioners

Comedy, starring Stefan Abingdon, Andrew Wakely and Ashley Horne

programme.desc: Charlie becomes infatuated with a ballet teacher, but finds to his dismay that he has a rival for her affections in the form of an equally smitten Jake. Comedy, starring Charlie Sheen, Jon Cryer and Angus T Jones

programme.desc: Six high-school students notice their teachers behaving strangely, and realise they have been replaced by shape-changing aliens who are planning to take over the world. Robert Rodriguez's sci-fi horror, starring Elijah Wood, Jordana Brewster, Josh Hartnett, Robert Patrick and Famke Janssen

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow comes to town, so William and Hester take along their Chinese vase to get a valuation. On their arrival back home the pair surprise a burglar, so Hester tries out her newly acquired martial arts skills. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. Rachel suspects the owner of supplying dynamite to armed robbery gangs, so Joe goes undercover to infiltrate the workforce - but ends up in mortal danger when his cover is blown. Meanwhile, Peggy sees an opportunity to make money when rumours abound that a meteorite caused the blast. Guest starring Bill Ward and Graeme Garden

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the case of a man who has acquired a well-paid but mysterious job - seemingly on account of his red hair. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett and David Burke, with Eric Porter as Moriarty

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar suspects fishy goings-on after veteran music manager Stan Sparrow chooses to hold his wedding reception at the Aidensfield Arms. When Stan is found dead the next day, investigations reveal his demise may not have been through natural causes. Meanwhile, Geoff is baffled by a boy reporting a crime that has yet to happen, and Peggy's conscience starts to trouble her when she hears the lad has gone missing. Guest starring Sue Jenkins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The X-ray machine breaks down, and Carnegie has to tell the hospital staff they won't be getting a replacement - meaning patients will have to be taken elsewhere. Dr Makori gets a crash course in dealing with the locals as she struggles to treat a complex ailment, and a window cleaner is injured while beating a hasty retreat from his married girlfriend's bedroom

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant and his anxious wife - believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness - calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester arranges a short cross-Channel trip to France to help take William's mind off his financial worries - and the pair end up shopping in Boulogne for duty free goods. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: David lies to Amy that his doctor has told him he will suffer a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. He claims to be heading to Spain with an old friend, but is actually planning a romantic reunion with Linda. Keith Barron and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Snoopy senior citizen Jessica Fletcher visits an old friend, now the Mother Superior of a convent, and finds herself investigating the puzzling death of a nun. Starring Angela Lansbury and Jane Powell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark is beginning to adjust to life in the town and finds a temporary position with the mayor's deputy at the council offices where his mum used to work, but he stumbles across a devastating secret about her that leaves him reeling. Meanwhile, teenage sister Jodie seems to be going off the rails, mixing with a dangerous older boy from school, and grandmother Betty starts a job at a local hotel, where she strikes up an odd friendship with a younger man. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Avigail Tlalim, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Frank Vickers is now firmly ensconced as head of the Vice Unit, with a mandate to institute a Draconian `zero-tolerance' policy. However, events soon take an ugly turn when Cheryl goes missing while on an undercover assignment to expose a pornographer. The disgraced Chappel goes out on a limb to rescue her - but a shocking revelation drives him to the brink of despair. Starring Ken Stott, Caroline Catz, David Harewood, Rosie Marcel and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Unfortunately, it turns out that a key witness's statement went astray during the earlier case - which leads to Frost being suspended from duty. Discreetly continuing his inquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. programme.desc: The arrival of their spouses prompts David and Linda to act quickly to get themselves off the hook. Comedy, starring Keith Barron

programme.title: Housesitter (1991)
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark tries to discuss his grievances over the police investigation with Alice, and then goes to the council to ask for Shireen's help. However, when Betty ends up in hospital, Jodie tells him to start focusing on his family and get over his obsession with the past. He agrees, but when a new piece of information about his parents comes to light, Mark knows he must keep pushing until the truth is uncovered. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Charlotte Riley, Goldy Notay and Julia McKenzie. Last in the series

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: As Joe returns to the Vice Unit, his first job is to nail a violent pimp - a case he doesn't think is going to stretch him too much. However, the operation runs into difficulties when the mother of one of the prostitutes involved recognises Vickers and threatens to expose some of his extracurricular activities unless he deals with the case personally. Gritty drama, starring David Harewood and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion. Maryna stands trial for her attack on Malikov and claims she was acting in self defence, while Walker pays the price for his insensitive handling of the case. Connor takes another look at Sofia's murder, considering whether Walker's obsession with pinning the crime on Malikov has led the team down the wrong path. Crime drama, starring David Hayman and Victoria Smurfit

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Two new residents put PC Mason in an awkward position both professionally and personally and, while the village rallies round to celebrate Blaketon's birthday, he gets more than he expected when Gina goes into labour. David decides to learn to play the piano. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire. Starring Joe McFadden, Tricia Penrose and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A wedding reception held on Elsinby Pier ends in tragedy when a fishing trawler sails badly off course. Meanwhile, Adam faces up to a tough decision and the staff at the hospital prepare for a new arrival as Jill goes into labour. Robert Cavanah and Amy Robbins star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth contemplates retiring while on a trip to the Lake District, but shelves his plans when Hastings meets a woman whose collection of valuable miniature portraits has been stolen. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: William and Hester devise an escape plan when Emma's overbearing in-laws invite themselves over to dinner and to stay the weekend. However, entering Nancy's granny flat proves a poor choice of strategy when the pair are mistaken for burglars. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: Judith Chalmers and her TV crew arrive to make a film about the resort, but when David is asked to be interviewed he enrages Amy by adopting an affected accent

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The thought of being a step-grandmother leaves Mildred distraught. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Two new residents put PC Mason in an awkward position both professionally and personally and, while the village rallies round to celebrate Blaketon's birthday, he gets more than he expected when Gina goes into labour. David decides to learn to play the piano. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire. Starring Joe McFadden, Tricia Penrose and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's cousin Emma, a vivacious dance hall performer, turns detective after she is suspected of murdering her lover by serving him poisoned herring. Frasier's Jane Leeves (Daphne) and veteran singer Anthony Newley appear alongside Angela Lansbury, who on this occasion plays Jessica Fletcher's sleuthing cousin Emma MacGill

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A kidnapper demands a ransom from a supermarket magnate in return for sparing the life of a boy who has been reported missing. Frost manages to identify a likely suspect - but with no clues to go on, it looks as if throwing away the rule book may be the only way to save the child. David Jason and Bruce Alexander star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl is snatched from a troubled housing estate, presenting a fresh challenge for clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill, who sets about trying to build up a profile of her abductor before time runs out. Unfortunately the case turns into a murder inquiry with the discovery of her body, and the team is left racing to save another innocent life. Robson Green and Simone Lahbib star

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Adam is assigned to help investigate a Soho amusement arcade manager suspected of running a rent-boy operation, but gets in way over his head when he is mistaken for a shy punter. Joe also experiences problems with the case as one of the boys involved leads him on a wild goose chase - just as he thinks he is about catch the suspected pimp. Crime drama, starring Mel Raido and David Harewood

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A kidnapper demands a ransom from a supermarket magnate in return for sparing the life of a boy who has been reported missing. Frost manages to identify a likely suspect - but with no clues to go on, it looks as if throwing away the rule book may be the only way to save the child. David Jason and Bruce Alexander star

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's cousin Emma, a vivacious dance hall performer, turns detective after she is suspected of murdering her lover by serving him poisoned herring. Frasier's Jane Leeves (Daphne) and veteran singer Anthony Newley appear alongside Angela Lansbury, who on this occasion plays Jessica Fletcher's sleuthing cousin Emma MacGill

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The youthful heir to a fortune disappears from boarding school in the dead of night - but his aristocratic father's aversion to publicity makes the case particularly difficult to investigate. Period drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike faces a stressful time as he struggles to cope with his wife's departure, and Tricia offers him a shoulder to cry on, but is beset by problems of her own after prescribing birth control to a 16-year-old. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: After finding out about the hospital's staffing problems, Jill offers to cut short her maternity leave and return to work, while Matron notices that Catherine is doing her best to avoid Adam. Out in Africa, Jeff faces the horrors of war and makes a promise to a dying woman - but faces difficulties in keeping his word

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An FBI agent crosses swords with Poirot while trying to retrieve the American Navy's top-secret plans for a new submarine, which have been stolen by a glamorous nightclub singer with a sideline in espionage. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester joins a sponsored cycle race to Brighton in aid of the RSPCA, but risks finishing up in worse shape than most of the animals she is trying to help. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: In an attempt to gain some time together David and Linda enlist gormless, accident-prone Neville as a go-between, knowing that neither Amy or Robert can stand him. However, he proves to be particularly inept at the task and innocently leads Amy to the would-be lovers' rendezvous

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper wants to install a shower, but a lack of cash forces a compromise on costs - and workmanship. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike faces a stressful time as he struggles to cope with his wife's departure, and Tricia offers him a shoulder to cry on, but is beset by problems of her own after prescribing birth control to a 16-year-old. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica helps Sheriff Amos Tupper investigate the murder of his deputy's wife and discovers a few surprising facts about the bereaved husband along the way. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury and Tom Bosley

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A starlet engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William decides to take Mary's advice and lose a few pounds, while the object of his affections is relieved to be given another chance at work, on the condition that she make herself available for night calls. It's a busy time at the funeral parlour, as three teenagers are killed in a car accident, and Molly seizes the opportunity to move closer to her daughter. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel has a lucky escape while walking home when she narrowly avoids being hit by a car. Shaken, she starts pursuing the driver, who has fled on foot, and the next day she suspects the incident was an attempted murder - and that Nick may be involved. As she tries to deal with the revelation, Janet is left to take charge of the latest case - the gang shooting of a teenager whose friend is a key witness. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Vickers goes undercover in a pole-dancing club thought to be the front for a prostitution racket, but he has to call on all his guile and cunning to get himself off the hook after Joe begins to realise his boss is in collusion with the chief suspect. Gritty drama, starring Tim Pigott-Smith, David Harewood and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow comes to town, so William and Hester take along their Chinese vase to get a valuation. On their arrival back home the pair surprise a burglar, so Hester tries out her newly acquired martial arts skills. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. Rachel suspects the owner of supplying dynamite to armed robbery gangs, so Joe goes undercover to infiltrate the workforce - but ends up in mortal danger when his cover is blown. Meanwhile, Peggy sees an opportunity to make money when rumours abound that a meteorite caused the blast. Guest starring Bill Ward and Graeme Garden

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Quebec to testify on behalf of an old friend wrongly accused of murdering his wife. Guest starring Patrick McGoohan (The Prisoner), Juliet Mills (Wild at Heart) and Claire Trevor (Key Largo)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the case of a man who has acquired a well-paid but mysterious job - seemingly on account of his red hair. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett and David Burke, with Eric Porter as Moriarty

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar suspects fishy goings-on after veteran music manager Stan Sparrow chooses to hold his wedding reception at the Aidensfield Arms. When Stan is found dead the next day, investigations reveal his demise may not have been through natural causes. Meanwhile, Geoff is baffled by a boy reporting a crime that has yet to happen, and Peggy's conscience starts to trouble her when she hears the lad has gone missing. Guest starring Sue Jenkins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The X-ray machine breaks down, and Carnegie has to tell the hospital staff they won't be getting a replacement - meaning patients will have to be taken elsewhere. Dr Makori gets a crash course in dealing with the locals as she struggles to treat a complex ailment, and a window cleaner is injured while beating a hasty retreat from his married girlfriend's bedroom

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant and his anxious wife - believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness - calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester arranges a short cross-Channel trip to France to help take William's mind off his financial worries - and the pair end up shopping in Boulogne for duty free goods. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: David lies to Amy that his doctor has told him he will suffer a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. He claims to be heading to Spain with an old friend, but is actually planning a romantic reunion with Linda. Keith Barron and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar suspects fishy goings-on after veteran music manager Stan Sparrow chooses to hold his wedding reception at the Aidensfield Arms. When Stan is found dead the next day, investigations reveal his demise may not have been through natural causes. Meanwhile, Geoff is baffled by a boy reporting a crime that has yet to happen, and Peggy's conscience starts to trouble her when she hears the lad has gone missing. Guest starring Sue Jenkins

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Snoopy senior citizen Jessica Fletcher visits an old friend, now the Mother Superior of a convent, and finds herself investigating the puzzling death of a nun. Starring Angela Lansbury and Jane Powell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark is beginning to adjust to life in the town and finds a temporary position with the mayor's deputy at the council offices where his mum used to work, but he stumbles across a devastating secret about her that leaves him reeling. Meanwhile, teenage sister Jodie seems to be going off the rails, mixing with a dangerous older boy from school, and grandmother Betty starts a job at a local hotel, where she strikes up an odd friendship with a younger man. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Avigail Tlalim, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Frank Vickers is now firmly ensconced as head of the Vice Unit, with a mandate to institute a Draconian `zero-tolerance' policy. However, events soon take an ugly turn when Cheryl goes missing while on an undercover assignment to expose a pornographer. The disgraced Chappel goes out on a limb to rescue her - but a shocking revelation drives him to the brink of despair. Starring Ken Stott, Caroline Catz, David Harewood, Rosie Marcel and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Unfortunately, it turns out that a key witness's statement went astray during the earlier case - which leads to Frost being suspended from duty. Discreetly continuing his inquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Snoopy senior citizen Jessica Fletcher visits an old friend, now the Mother Superior of a convent, and finds herself investigating the puzzling death of a nun. Starring Angela Lansbury and Jane Powell

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Moriarty seeks revenge on Holmes for foiling his plan to sell the Mona Lisa, and the pair ultimately fight their final battle at the Reichenbach Falls in Switzerland. Jeremy Brett stars as the titular hero, with David Burke making his final appearance as Dr Watson and Eric Porter as Moriarty. Last in the series

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Carol asks Joe for assistance when suspicions mount against her following the death of a pensioner who she frequently visited. Peggy is annoyed to find a pile of rubbish has been dumped in her backyard and Gina shares her concerns with Carol as she approaches the end of her pregnancy

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient who set fire to his own shop (guest star Tony Slattery) attempts to avoid police questioning by leaping into an ambulance and driving off towards the pier - unaware Alun and a sick man are in the back of the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dr Makori fears for her relationship with Dr Fox when he tells her he has been offered a job in Biafra. Medical drama, with Andy Wear, Paul Fox and Kananu Kirimi

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. Poirot, who has acquired a parrot and developed a taste for conjuring tricks, bets the baffled Inspector Japp Â£5 he can solve the mystery without leaving his own apartment. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester thinks William has been unfaithful when he comes home from work reeking of perfume. He offers her a perfectly innocent explanation, but she continues to fear the worst. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: The arrival of their spouses prompts David and Linda to act quickly to get themselves off the hook. Comedy, starring Keith Barron

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Henpecked George finally finds a job, but the line of work could make him unpopular with road users. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Carol asks Joe for assistance when suspicions mount against her following the death of a pensioner who she frequently visited. Peggy is annoyed to find a pile of rubbish has been dumped in her backyard and Gina shares her concerns with Carol as she approaches the end of her pregnancy

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The seemingly accidental death of a tycoon turns out to be murder, leading to a corporate power struggle - but fortunately, stand-in board member Jessica Fletcher is on hand to unmask the culprit. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Housesitter (1991)
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark tries to discuss his grievances over the police investigation with Alice, and then goes to the council to ask for Shireen's help. However, when Betty ends up in hospital, Jodie tells him to start focusing on his family and get over his obsession with the past. He agrees, but when a new piece of information about his parents comes to light, Mark knows he must keep pushing until the truth is uncovered. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Charlotte Riley, Goldy Notay and Julia McKenzie. Last in the series

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: As Joe returns to the Vice Unit, his first job is to nail a violent pimp - a case he doesn't think is going to stretch him too much. However, the operation runs into difficulties when the mother of one of the prostitutes involved recognises Vickers and threatens to expose some of his extracurricular activities unless he deals with the case personally. Gritty drama, starring David Harewood and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion. Maryna stands trial for her attack on Malikov and claims she was acting in self defence, while Walker pays the price for his insensitive handling of the case. Connor takes another look at Sofia's murder, considering whether Walker's obsession with pinning the crime on Malikov has led the team down the wrong path. Crime drama, starring David Hayman and Victoria Smurfit

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Moriarty seeks revenge on Holmes for foiling his plan to sell the Mona Lisa, and the pair ultimately fight their final battle at the Reichenbach Falls in Switzerland. Jeremy Brett stars as the titular hero, with David Burke making his final appearance as Dr Watson and Eric Porter as Moriarty. Last in the series

David decides to learn to play the piano. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire. Starring Joe McFadden, Tricia Penrose and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A wedding reception held on Elsinby Pier ends in tragedy when a fishing trawler sails badly off course. Meanwhile, Adam faces up to a tough decision and the staff at the hospital prepare for a new arrival as Jill goes into labour. Robert Cavanah and Amy Robbins star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth contemplates retiring while on a trip to the Lake District, but shelves his plans when Hastings meets a woman whose collection of valuable miniature portraits has been stolen. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's cousin Emma, a vivacious dance hall performer, turns detective after she is suspected of murdering her lover by serving him poisoned herring. Frasier's Jane Leeves (Daphne) and veteran singer Anthony Newley appear alongside Angela Lansbury, who on this occasion plays Jessica Fletcher's sleuthing cousin Emma MacGill

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The youthful heir to a fortune disappears from boarding school in the dead of night - but his aristocratic father's aversion to publicity makes the case particularly difficult to investigate. Period drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike faces a stressful time as he struggles to cope with his wife's departure, and Tricia offers him a shoulder to cry on, but is beset by problems of her own after prescribing birth control to a 16-year-old. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: After finding out about the hospital's staffing problems, Jill offers to cut short her maternity leave and return to work, while Matron notices that Catherine is doing her best to avoid Adam. Out in Africa, Jeff faces the horrors of war and makes a promise to a dying woman - but faces difficulties in keeping his word

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An FBI agent crosses swords with Poirot while trying to retrieve the American Navy's top-secret plans for a new submarine, which have been stolen by a glamorous nightclub singer with a sideline in espionage. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester joins a sponsored cycle race to Brighton in aid of the RSPCA, but risks finishing up in worse shape than most of the animals she is trying to help. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: In an attempt to gain some time together David and Linda enlist gormless, accident-prone Neville as a go-between, knowing that neither Amy or Robert can stand him. However, he proves to be particularly inept at the task and innocently leads Amy to the would-be lovers' rendezvous

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper wants to install a shower, but a lack of cash forces a compromise on costs - and workmanship. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica helps Sheriff Amos Tupper investigate the murder of his deputy's wife and discovers a few surprising facts about the bereaved husband along the way. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury and Tom Bosley

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A starlet engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William decides to take Mary's advice and lose a few pounds, while the object of his affections is relieved to be given another chance at work, on the condition that she make herself available for night calls. It's a busy time at the funeral parlour, as three teenagers are killed in a car accident, and Molly seizes the opportunity to move closer to her daughter. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel has a lucky escape while walking home when she narrowly avoids being hit by a car. Shaken, she starts pursuing the driver, who has fled on foot, and the next day she suspects the incident was an attempted murder - and that Nick may be involved. As she tries to deal with the revelation, Janet is left to take charge of the latest case - the gang shooting of a teenager whose friend is a key witness. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.desc: Fulham v Sheffield United (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the fourth-round replay at Craven Cottage, where the Blades are aiming to produce an upset. programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: John Rambo returns to the jungles of Vietnam on a life-or-death mission to rescue American PoWs. In the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, with Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul and Steven Berkoff. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Divorce Court
programme.desc: A man accuses his wife of laziness and heavy drinking. She says he is too controlling and drove her to drink

programme.title: Bridezillas
programme.desc: A stressful dress fitting pushes short-tempered Jeanine over the edge, and Marlene becomes irate when the groom goes missing on her big day

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A depressed Guppy is forced to make a tough decision on an emergency rescue and grows increasingly despondent when he makes a mistake that puts a patient's life in danger. Stitch calls the disillusioned medic to his office and places temptation in his path by revealing he uses cocaine to cope with the stress of work. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to persuade a bouncer to seek help after learning he is self-harming. Jodi Albert, Roy Hudd and Scott Mills guest star

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Cyd is bitten by a venomous snake inadvertently transported from Peru, prompting Dixie to finally declare her true feelings as the team fight to save their colleague's life. Stitch is furious to discover Guppy stole his drugs and performed an operation while under the influence, and an escaped prisoner is confronted by his daughter

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The chefs are divided into teams to prepare four dishes for an afternoon tea with 100 guests. While some contestants gather ingredients, others make their own flour

programme.title: King of Tarts
programme.desc: Master patissier Adriano Zumbo challenges the staff to create an original dessert

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a three-bedroom property being put up for auction in south Wales, a two-bedroom terrace in north London with a woodwork problem, and a semi-detached residence in Lancashire

programme.title: Children's Hospital
programme.desc: Daniel undergoes surgery to repair his facial structure

programme.title: Children's Hospital
programme.desc: Todd's spleen is removed as he battles a bleeding disorder

programme.title: Medical Emergency
programme.desc: A small boy is treated after being bitten by a venomous spider, and a man is rushed to hospital by air ambulance

programme.title: Medical Emergency
programme.desc: A patient waits months for a donor heart, and a cyclist sustains neck injuries

programme.title: Emergency Bikers
programme.desc: Paramedic Steve Harris struggles to help the driver of a crashed car, and police officer Martin Ackers recreates the final moments of a fatal motorcycle accident to determine what went wrong. Meanwhile, Mark Hayes tends a man who has been attacked, and an emergency biker works to rescue marine mammals on Scotland's beaches

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties in the Welsh city of Newport, London and Chorley, Lancashire

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The cooks attend a masterclass in which Lorraine Pascal prepares a mojito genoise cake, Gary makes roasted pork rack and George prepares two salmon dishes

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother coping with the death of her brother goes into labour with her fifth child, and her sister discusses how the pregnancy has helped the family cope with the bereavement. Meanwhile, a woman who received IVF treatment anxiously prepares to give birth, but when her waters fail to break she is asked to consider undergoing a Caesarean

programme.title: Boys Joined at the Head
programme.desc: The story of conjoined twins from Cairo who were sent to a hospital in Dallas to separate them in 2003. The chances of success were increased when it was discovered the siblings each had their own brain, but it was still a highly complex procedure. programme.desc: The spy is intrigued to discover Sarah has a date at a restaurant with a mysterious man, but panics when the Intersect reveals her companion has a very shady past - and is stunned to learn the man is her father Jack. Beckman also takes an interest when she hears Jack has recently conned a sheik suspected of funding terrorism, and arranges for him to join the team on a mission to find out more about his activities. Meanwhile, Morgan makes an ill-advised purchase. Guest starring Gary Cole (Office Space)

programme.title: Seventeen and Missing (2006)
programme.desc: A mother with clairvoyant abilities is distraught when her teenage daughter goes missing. She finds herself plagued by traumatic visions of the girl's abduction, which might provide the vital clue to rescuing her, and turns to her estranged husband for help in tracking down their child. Thriller, starring Dedee Pfeiffer, Matthew Harrison and Tegan Moss

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A man arrested for a shooting decides to represent himself in court - and proves to be far more formidable than expected. Horatio realises the only thing that can put him behind bars is the eyewitness testimony of the victim's son, but is reluctant to put the boy on the stand

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac, Danny, Flack and Lindsay investigate the case of a middle-aged tycoon killed in a lift, and discover a world in which girls meet much older men for sexual encounters. Stella and Hawkes uncover the identity of a body found in Central Park, learning the victim had been living a double life which ultimately led to his death. Drama, starring Gary Sinise

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The case of a murdered jockey leads Jane and the team into the murky underworld of horse racing, where they uncover a number of suspects. Crime drama, guest starring Jim Beaver (Deadwood) and Olesya Rulin (High School Musical), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green look into the shooting of defence lawyer Vance Grodie, who had just won an acquittal for a suspected cop killer. Their investigations reveal a link to a network of conservative extremists, and the discovery leads the case into an examination of civil rights. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A patrolman is murdered during a routine traffic stop, and Horatio and the team discover the vehicle used during the crime was driven by a 16-year-old student. She denies being involved in the killing and immediately implicates someone else, but tests on the recovered murder weapon suggest she is lying. Her mother continues to defend her daughter, until events take a dramatic turn

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A model collapses and dies on the catwalk during a fashion show - and it is not long before a second body is found in the cargo area just outside the venue. Meanwhile, a terminally ill patient claims he killed his doctor - but Stella and Flack realise his story cannot be true. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes, Eddie Cahill and Hill Harper

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The drama about an NYPD team specialising in sexual crimes returns. Mackenzie Burton disappears from her family home while her mother Pam is taking a bath and when Benson and Stabler investigate, they can find no sign of forced entry. The girl's father tells them that Mackenzie was adopted and also reveals that he and his wife's biological daughter Ella was abducted 10 years previously - a case that remains unsolved. Guest starring Joan Cusack, Peter Strauss and Ian Henry Cusick

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: A high-end litigator at a downtown law office goes missing, and his colleague believes that the firm's partners, specialists in corporate crime, are involved. Moreland cosies up to the managing partner Christopher Locke, and engages the whistle-blower in a dangerous sting operation to find the truth

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt searches for a missing Native American boy who has been fostered by a white family, and suspects the child's birth parents may have abducted him

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your day with all the latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team

programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts

programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia

programme.title: Let's Make a Deal
programme.desc: An update of the classic game show in which contestants wearing outrageous costumes make deals with the host to win money and prizes

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: 'Come on down!' Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972, though it originated with Bill Cullen on NBC (1956-63) and ABC (1963-65). However, it was the genial, ageless Barker who really sold viewers on the show, which spawned several syndicated offshoots and a string of prime-time specials. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes

programme.title: The Bold and the Beautiful

In 2004, the show introduced a new family, the Marones, and recruited several nighttime alums to beef up the cast. And to create a little chaos

programme.title: The Amish
programme.desc: Conclusion. The insular Amish religious community is examined. The documentary features audio of Amish members discussing their lives (their faith precludes having their pictures taken) as well as remarks from experts and former Amish members. Amish history, which dates to the late 1600s, is also detailed, including the persecution that led adherents to leave Europe for Pennsylvania in the early 1700s. Education, rumspringa and the 2006 Lancaster County, Pa., school shooting are also covered

programme.title: The Amish Shunned
programme.desc: The Amish practice of shunning those who leave their faith is explored through the experiences of individuals who have left their communities. Also: faithful Amish men and women share the heartbreak they feel when a loved one leaves

programme.title: Nature
programme.desc: Paul Giamatti narrates this look at the world of ducks, which focuses on a male and female wood duck that meet and raise a family. The babies arrive knowing what to do and how to do it, and once in the water need no help in sifting and skimming for food. The differences between dabblers, such as wood ducks, and divers, such as ruddies, is also explained. Dabblers feast on the plants, crustaceans and larvae found atop ponds and lakes; divers, however, feed on the rocky and sandy floors

programme.title: Nova
programme.desc: An investigation of a mass grave found in the catacombs beneath the streets of Rome sheds insight into ancient Romans' daily lives and health. Included: who the buried people may have been; why so many were interred in one place; and what killed them

programme.desc: Skyscrapers that are pushing the limits of engineering, technology and design are featured in this four-part series, which opens with a look at One World Trade Center, the tallest building in the western hemisphere. programme.title: The Tourist
programme.desc: An American tourist named Frank is dragged into a dangerous world of intrigue and espionage after crossing paths with mysterious beauty Elise while traveling Europe by train. Before long, Frank is dodging bullets in Paris and the winding canals of Venice, but the faster he and Elise run, the more intense their romance grows

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman (Cameron Diaz) and a spy (Tom Cruise) race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Charlie becomes impotent when armchair psychoanalyst Rose tells him he has unresolved issues with his mom. Meanwhile, Alan gets angry when Charlie gives Jake advice about girls. Jake: Angus T. Jones. Rose: Melanie Lynskey

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Charlie is thrilled that he's dating a hot, exciting woman (Jodi Lyn O'Keefe), but Alan can't find much to like about her. In fact, he's sure that she has put a curse on both Charlie and him

programme.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love.

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Martin Sheen guest stars as Rose's dad, who confronts Charlie and asks what his intentions are towards his daughter after an inebriated Charlie sleeps with Rose on her birthday. Margaret: June Squibb. Rose: Melanie Lynskey. Evelyn: Holland Taylor. Alan: Jon Cryer

programme.desc: A teenage girl is murdered, and her father suggests the detectives investigate her controlling therapist. Things get complicated when the therapist produces an alibi and one of his other patients breaks into the morgue

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Stabler works with Benson on a rape case until he gets sidetracked by the problems of his son, who has gotten into serious trouble with his best friend, a recovering drug addict

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Stabler takes a special interest in the welfare of an elderly woman (Melinda Dillon) who claims that she's not the victim of physical abuse by her son (Matt Schulze). Frances Chandler: Judith Ivey. Carol: Christine Elise. Sam: Lauren Hodges. Stabler: Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The discovery of a dismembered corpse leads detectives to a body-parts ring that operates in the black market. Amy Solwey: Marlee Matlin. Bianco: Marc Grapey. McGovern: Kevin Carroll. Dr. Swan: John Ottavino. Munch: Richard Belzer. Stabler: Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A former victim of Tibetan political torture is found murdered, with one of her feet missing. Mrs. Krug: Margaret Colin. Gina Bernardo: Illeana Douglas. Preston Bennett: Frederick Weller. Munch: Richard Belzer. Benson: Mariska Hargitay. Stabler: Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation of a woman's death involves three suspects: her psychiatrist (Dennis Boutsikaris), a TV anchor man (Michael Nouri) and the deceased's father (Paul Hecht). Ellen Travis: Laila Robins. Kathy Stabler: Isabel Gillies. ADA Abbie Carmichael: Angie Harmon

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody is cowed by the advances of Kelly's mother (Melendy Britt), while urban cowboy Cliff rides the bar's new mechanical bull. Kelly: Jackie Swanson. Mr. Gaines: Richard Doyle. Conrad: Bill Geisslinger. Phil: Robert Gallo. Mechanic: D. David Morin. Fireman: Kevin McDermott

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Season 7 premiere: House and Cuddy explore their feelings toward each other amid a crisis at the hospital: the threatened loss of its Level 1 status as a trauma center because the only available neurosurgeon (George Wyner) is sick. The diagnosis of the doctor's illness is difficult, but House doesn't offer to help. Meanwhile, Thirteen has a request for House

programme.title: Street Kings
programme.desc: A cynical, violent tale of dirty cops and psychotic thugs, this hardboiled LA story bogs down in crime-movie clichés. Disgraced detective Tom Ludlow (Keanu Reeves) is set up for the murder of his ex-partner, who was working with Internal Affairs. Fellow officers close ranks around Ludlow, but he ignores his Captain's advice to lay low and blunders into a swamp of corruption and unbridled ambition. Forest Whitaker, Hugh Laurie, Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of one of their own, an NCIS agent who was working on a cold case when he was shot and nearly disemboweled. Kate: Sasha Alexander. Tony: Michael Weatherly. Ducky: David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS agents search for a missing marine, who unbeknownst to them, is being tortured in a cell by a mysterious captor. Tony: Michael Weatherly. Kate: Sasha Alexander. Gibbs: Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a Marine is killed with a specialized military weapon, the agents investigate the illegal weapons market and find an undercover ATF agent (Bellamy Young) also working on the case, and Gibbs asks her to work with them to find the killer. SSgt. Washington: Laz Alonso. SSgt. Rafael: Sam Witwer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs' team investigates the death of a SEAL during a training exercise, and come to suspect that it wasn't an accident, but a murder. Cdr. Rainer: Adam Baldwin. Larry Clannon: Doug Savant. CIA Agent Kramer: Johnny Sneed. Lt. Johnson: Tom R. Hughes. Agent McGee: Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs' obsession with finding the terrorist Ari (Rudolf Martin) reaches its zenith, and is timed perfectly, as Ari is training men for an attack on Marine One with President Bush and Prime Minister Sharon on board. Kate: Sasha Alexander. Abby: Pauley Perrette. Tony: Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to help a Navy captain (David Keith) working for the Pentagon, whose wife and blind daughter are being held hostage by a man demanding $2 million in ransom. Sandy: Abigail Breslin. Julie: Ely Pouget. Kyle Grayson: William Mapother. McGee: Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the semi-mummified corpse of a woman chained in an underground room at an abandoned military base, and deduces that the perpetrator is probably repeating the crime with another victim. PO Barbara Swain: Betsy Brandt. Lt. Evans: Matt Carmody. PO Marshall: Tara Buck

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine helicopter is found abandoned in a crop circle on a farm, and the two pilots, who were out on a proficiency flight, can't be located. Ritt Everett: Timothy Bottoms. Sheriff Thompson: Tom Bower. Lt. Col. Curtis Teague: Robert Rusler. Kate: Sasha Alexander

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The deaths of a marine and his two friends are investigated; and Gibbs gets the final decision regarding Ziva, but is unprepared for how the news affects him

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood. Meanwhile, Tony suspects that Ziva is plotting to avenge her father's death

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil relishes the idea of talking about real estate for Career Day at Luke and Manny's school—until it turns into the mother of all turf battles when his nemesis, Gil Thorpe, shows up. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron are on tooth-fairy duty, but a mistake has them looking down in the mouth; and Gloria challenges Jay's claims of wanting to be a novelist

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron get a surprise visit from their friend Sal, who arrives with the news that she's getting married—and Mitch and Cam are the best men. Meanwhile, Gloria doesn't trust her new nanny; Claire bonds with Haley; and Phil gives romantic advice to Luke about a girl he likes

programme.title: Psych
programme.desc: Gus falls for a sexy private eye while investigating a man whose life mirrors his own

programme.title: Fast Five
programme.desc: Brian, Mia and wanted fugitive Dom (Vin Diesel) make their way to Rio and assemble Brazil's top racers to confront the crooked businessman who seeks to silence them forever. Meanwhile, Federal Agent Hobbs realizes he may be chasing the wrong people

programme.title: Psych
programme.desc: Gus falls for a sexy private eye while investigating a man whose life mirrors his own

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Goren's inmate nephew believes he witnessed a murder, so Goren goes undercover in the mental ward to investigate the possible crime

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into an execution-style shooting of three college freshmen takes an emotional toll on Logan and Falacci

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation of an apparent suicide leads to a case involving members of a wealthy family. Candace Lamerly: Michael Learned. Drew Lamerly: Erik von Detten. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson (Chris Meloni, Mariska Hargitay) investigate the case of a beaten teen model who was dumped in front of a hospital

programme.desc: A couple in a witness-protection program are murdered and Goren and Eames speak to their daughter (Gaby Hoffman), who turns out to be adopted. Trevor: John Shea. Maureen: Melissa Leo. Nina: Deirdre O'Connell. Dennis: Michael Hobbs. Camille: Lizbeth Mackay. Goren: Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: A psychiatrist and his son (George Segal, Jonathan Tucker) are implicated in the murder of a gay model. Emma Dishell: Daphne Zuniga. Dave Seaver: Michael Boatman. DA Arthur Branch: Fred Dalton Thompson

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: Isaac Asimov's sci-fi stories inspired this slick blend of high-tech effects and action. Will Smith plays a cop who uncovers a conspiracy involving murderous robots in 2035

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: An ice age is brought on by the effects of global warming and paleoclimatologist Jack Hall struggles through the masses fleeing south for warmer climate on his way north to reunite with his son

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Callen goes undercover as an old alias from his past to investigate the murder of a recently released convict

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House is working solo (with some diagnostic help from a hospital janitor) as Season 4 begins. While Cuddy and Wilson nag him to hire a new team, he must treat a young woman who was injured in an explosion. But her injuries aren't what's killing her. Indeed, her repeated crises, each of which House treats successfully, seem to be caused by personal behaviors that baffle her boyfriend. Meanwhile, House's new prized possession, a 1967 Gibson Flying V guitar, is missing

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A prospective astronaut has an attack of synesthesia in a flight simulator, then asks House to diagnose her off the books. House shares the case with the candidates he has rounded up to replace Cameron, Chase and Foreman (40 of them, initially). Meanwhile, House sees his three former underlings in the hospital---or thinks he does

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman in a tenement is raped and murdered in front of her 6-year-old son (Max Weinstein). Not surprisingly, the boy is too traumatized to answer questions. And one of them turns out to be, What were they doing in that apartment in the first place? They weren't poor, but they were on the run. Dan Hoffman: Rob Estes. Kim Hoffman: Signy Coleman. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson investigate the murder of a young woman mistaken for a prostitute

programme.title: Eight Below

programme.title: CSI
